cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles (480 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico and 305 miles south-southeast of the western tip of Cuba

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin moving NW soon)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, cross or skirt the northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana/Mississippi Gulf Coast mid-week before curving northeast across the interior Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday; secondary U.S. landfall along the central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana/Mississippi coast) Wednesday night

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning currently confined to the Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel); Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos including Cozumel; no U.S. coast warnings yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, then central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Mississippi by mid-week
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no northeast U.S. sites listed in Advisory #4 wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at New York, NY & NJ under current forecast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port based on present track and surge guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain late next week if the system’s remnants pass nearby
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential minor river or urban flooding if remnants stall, otherwise no significant tropical hazards anticipated for port operations
